description: From Latin frīvolus (“silly, empty, trifling, frivolous, worthless”), with the ending modified to match -ous.

adjectives.description: frivolous (comparative more frivolous, superlative most frivolous)

entries.meaning: Silly, especially at an inappropriate time or in an inappropriate manner.
Of little weight or importance; not worth notice; slight; trivial.

(law, said of a lawsuit) Having no reasonable prospect of success because its claim is without merit, lacking a supporting legal or factual basis, while the filing party is, or should be, aware of this.
examples: One of the major cost drivers in the delivery of health care are these junk and frivolous lawsuits.
